name: Lac defloratum
Relationship: Compare: COLOSTRUM. (Diarrhoea in infants. Whole body smells sour. Colic.) NAT-MUR.

Head: Pain begins in forehead to occiput, in morning on rising
Intense throbbing, with nausea, vomiting, blindness, and obstinate constipation; worse, noise, light, motion, during menses, with great prostration, and better by pressure and bandaging head tightly
Despondent
Stool: Stools hard, large, with great straining; painful, lacerating anus

details: A remedy for diseases with faulty nutrition; sick headaches; with profuse flow of urine DURING pain. CAR SICKNESS.
dosage: Sixth, to thirtieth potency and higher.
